channel.title: Nosql on Harecoded
channel.description: Recent content in Nosql on Harecoded

item.title: Delete keys by pattern using REDIS-cli
item.description: I do store a lot of statistical data in Redis, storing information on what users do and behave every day, week, month and so on... But storing a huge amount of data in memory has a little drawback: memory is cheap and fast, but is finite. From time to time (e.g: cron job) I need to clean up the house because there is too much memory filled that is no longer interesting to keep it.

item.title: non-RDBM distributed databases, map/reduce, key/value and cloud computing
item.description: I've been playing recently with several distributed databases with the aim of choosing the best solution for my needs. Since there isn't much documentation on the web with a general overview on the subject, I write here some comments, thoughts and my humble experience. Hope it's usefull for you, this document is not a comparison of performance, or a "mine is bigger than yours",  just some ideas ;) My background
